website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you are looking for a STEM toy for an older child – this robotic arm has everything needed to provide challenging and rewarding fun.
pros: Provides everything kids need to build a hydraulic robotic arm without electricity or batteries
Has 229 parts – ideal for kids 10 and older who are inspired by engineering
cons: A challenging toy with intricate pieces – if you are looking for an engineering toy for small kids, this isn't a good pick

customer_reviews.title: This thing is freaking awesome. Well engineered with decent material
customer_reviews.text: This thing is freaking awesome. Well engineered with decent material. Not metal parts but reasonably strong plastic. The instructions are very clear but it will take hours to construct. I would guess 4 hours of solid concentration. Let the kid start it with you, put him to bed, have some beer and finish it. Mechanically, my one gripe is the spindle gear (pictured) has a lot of play in it. It feels cheap when you operate it. Still, I would easily place this at the $75 price point. Follow the instructions drink the beer and wake up when your kid does so you can modulate the enthusiasm. It is still plastic after all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging kit with long term play potential.
customer_reviews.text: My mechanically inclined thirteen year old son really enjoyed putting this together, and has integrated this into all manner of creative play and projects since. Beginners might find this frustrating difficult, but if you need a challenging kit, this is a great choice. Well thought out and very detailed instructions. Would very much recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rein Teder

customer_reviews.title: almost, but fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed assembling this for my son however the piston for the gripper was too big for the O-ring and I had to switch it with the rotation setup. The brakes also do not work very well and I think i'll need to add some adhesive to make them work better. The kit had some very nice and detailed parts that were well engineered and fairly easy to assemble. Despite the good directions this kit took me about 2 or 3 hours to assemble. I wish they color coded the parts in the instructions. It would have made finding the right part a bit easier. Really a shame the one piston (maybe most important) didn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Schoch

customer_reviews.title: wish I had never bought this. cheap cheap plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: wish I had never bought this. cheap cheap plastic. Broke several pieces trying to put it together. I bought it as a gift for my son, and by the time we tried to put it together, the 30 day return window had passed. So we are stuck with a bunch of broken plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Spend some quality time with your kids!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good about this... toy, i guess? I can’t believe some of the reviews knocking it because it takes time to put togeather. That is the point, to spend time with your kids teaching them the mechanics of how it works and building. My son who is 10 received a new xbox one, a remote control car and nerf guns for Christmas. This is the toy I find him playing with watching the moving parts intently learning how it works. Today to find something that keeps their interest that don’t have a screen is a win! Thank you for offering such a great project-toy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: it worth every penny you spent!
customer_reviews.text: I will give it six stars if could. It is well designed with very detailed manual. All the parts are well packed and assembled seamlessly. The entire building process is full of joy and surprise (in it's design...). for 1 star reviewer, I felt sorry about your frustration. Honestly I think it's quite challenging for kids below 15 years, a lot of details need to follow the manual. But the product itself is really good!
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: Cool Kit, Detailed Instructions, Challenging
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed easy to understand instruction manual. Will require several hours to assemble and small diagonal cutters, a razor blade, and a small phillips screwdriver to assemble. Magnifiers also recommended if you don't have perfect vision. The building process is the most enjoyable part for me. The assembled arm is impressive. Love this thing! Not for kids that are too young (maybe not for less that about a 10 year old) - Will need guidance from an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Brown

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my ten year old's birthday. ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my ten year old's birthday. I think he was a little intimidated by it, but with some help from dad, he got it! No tears required. Think extreme leggo project, but this one moves and doesn't get left on the floor to get stuck in your feet.. haha
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Water leaks out. Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It's was fun to put together. But it doesn't work for more then a few minutes. The water all leaks out. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Need tiny Phillips screwdriver, large muscles
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, directions were straightforward. On the minus side, many parts involved tiny self-tapping screws that were almost impossible to tighten all the way. It requires tons of downward force on the screw in order to turn it without stripping the head. In several cases, a simple snap-together approach would have worked and been far easier. It took about eight evenings to get this thing assembled. At the end, we never could get the claw or the suction cup to work correctly; it kept sticking open. The other joints worked well. The boys were impressed with the hydraulic magic involved, and were able to make fixes, tube refills and so forth on their own.
customer_reviews.author: J. Levy

customer_reviews.title: He's takes very good care of his stuff and today while using it ...
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old has had this for 3 months and it broke. He's takes very good care of his stuff and today while using it two of try controller sticks broke off. Cheap junk. He spent his own allowance on this which stinks. Won't be buying anything from OWI again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua P Hicks

customer_reviews.title: This is great quality & fun
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase! My 9 year old son wanted a robot kit & hesitantly I purchased this (rated age 12 & older). I helped him put it together & it was an awesome bonding experience. We worked on it for 30-45 minutes at a time & it was fun for both of us. Once assembled IT WORKS! And it works well! I suggest using toenail clippers to remove the "burrs" from plastic parts (you have to detatch parts from sheets of plastic).
customer_reviews.author: Sara Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8-year-old and we worked on it together. One of the pieces snapped half way through building it and I didn’t have a big enough box to return. Amazon gave me a small partial refund and I just super glued the piece together. It was a great project for us to work on together and it works great. Easy to follow instructions. Even with the broken piece I gave it five stars. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Quality time with kids.
customer_reviews.text: If your kid likes or liked legos this will be an awesome project. My kid absolutely got into the building process and is very satisfied with the outcome. Though he does not play with as much now the building was a great father son project and thaught him a bit about hydraulics. Very satisfied with this project.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as a gift but sadly it has ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift but sadly it has not been completed as parts were missing. Be aware they are hooked together and there are many. I wish it had been returned as it was a birthday gift but sadly, I only found out later. So, an expensive, unfinished piece of plastic? :-(
customer_reviews.author: Janet J.

customer_reviews.title: I was ready to give it 5 stars...
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give it 5 stars, even when it started leaking soon after finished, but we found that drooped price after Christmas, I pay 60, now you can buy it for 40! It was a heck of a experience! My 9 year old built it! I helped him tightening the screws and with the hydraulics but the experience was amazing! Even the reloading the pistons the next day and purging the system was fun!
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made with cheap parts
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our elementary age son who does great with STEM learning and toys. However, on the first step he couldn't get the screw in. I found that all the screws were made poorly and so weak that trying to use the required force to screw them in strips them. Unfortunately OWI won't stand behind their product.... unless you find the broken or damaged parts within 30 days of purchase, they won't help. Lots of other reviewers note the same issue. Don't waste your money with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Grady

customer_reviews.title: great project for teen
customer_reviews.text: My son has been doing these stem style projects for years and loves them. He is 14 and this is more advanced than any of the other ones. He really enjoyed putting it together because it took a few hours. He did need help on measuring the tubes and cutting some of the parts out of the sprues (they weren't the easiest to just break out. We used some snips). Highly recommend only removing parts as you need them as they are all well organized.
customer_reviews.author: Arika Capo-chichi

customer_reviews.title: This was a DELIGHTFULLY fun project!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this kit to occupy time during quarantine. There are lots of pieces and good instructions, but buyers should be aware that the pieces are extremely fragile! We have already broken three pieces and had to glue them. Since this is our first robot kit, it could just be our big clumsy hands. Anyone buying this kit should be prepared for small, delicate pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C.

customer_reviews.title: 13 year old grandson loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandson's birthday, but 10 year old brother and 40ish Dad had a wonderful family time helping him put it together. It took hours, and it still holds quite a bit of interest, but it is sure to be one of those toys that's a huge hit at first, but after you learn all the tricks of building and operating it, there are no new and different ways to use it. I still recommend it though if you want that great happy Grammie glow when your gift receiver opens it up with a WOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Son loved it for about 10mins.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons 11th b-day. Hes very into the robotics as dad is a robotics engineer. I had very high hopes for this. He and dad spent 3ish hrs building it together. He was so happy with it...for like 10mins. Now the thing leaks water everywhere and hes annoyed with it. Him and dad are currently trying to fix the leaking but I'm not sure it can be fixed without us spending money on parts for it. For a $40+ dollar toy I figured he'd get more then 10mins or joy out of it. Kinda bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole HS

customer_reviews.title: My 14 year old son had fun putting this together with his dad
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old son had fun putting this together with his dad. It's one of those things though that once it's put together it kind of just sits there. It's pretty cool that it's truly hydraulic but if you're not careful the tube will pull out and you have to repressurize it. It took several hours over two days to put together so it was worth it. Plus it helped him learn about hydraulic pressure first hand.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but hoses pop off during use
customer_reviews.text: Fun to put together and a nice idea. The hoses are terrible and pop off during normal use spraying everyone around and causing you to have to disassemble half the arm to refill the cylinders and get the air out. After this happened a handful of times, I used twist ties (stripped) to wrap around each connection and twist it with a needle nose plier to clamp the hoses on. Really the thing should come with hose clamps or a tighter tube ought to be used and/or the piston nipples ought to have one way ridges to ensure the tubes don’t pop off under normal working pressures.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan P

customer_reviews.title: but then the directions weren't the best according to his dad
customer_reviews.text: it was a gift for my 10 year old grandson. initially it went well putting it together. but then the directions weren't the best according to his dad. so it is still is in the process of being completed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our genius neighbor, a 13 year old who understands the principles of displacement, electronics, and html coding. His parents said that he opened it, and was fascinated with the assembly and action. He got to open this present Christmas eve, and spent about 6 hours working on it, ignoring all of the wrapped gifts under the tree until this toy was complete.
customer_reviews.author: RobNDenver

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, taiwan made
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, taiwan made. 11 year old took 9 hours to build. It may need adult help with some screws and to be sure directions are followed. This is a high quality, detailed, working hydraulic model with a need for detailed following of instructions and a great lesson in assembly detail, and functionality. Great job.
customer_reviews.author: Madilynn

customer_reviews.title: impressive toy
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his 12th birthday. He is a little engineer and he really likes the toy. My one concern is if they hydraulic cylinders will require more lubrication over time. They give you a small amount of lubricant in a tear-open pouch so it can't be resealed or stored easily. The lubricant looks like it might be mineral oil. You would want some lubricant that won't damage the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Awesome engineering project for 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 9 year old as a quarantine project. There were only a few steps I had to help him, like cutting some pieces cleaner to fit. But he was able to follow most instructions on his own. It took him maybe an hour every day for about a week or so. The finished product was awesome. He demonstrated at online meet to his teacher and class. So cool!!! I would give this 10 stars but too bad the stars stop at 5!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Stunning kit! Our 11 year old loves it. ...
customer_reviews.text: Stunning kit! Our 11 year old loves it. He was instructed to put it together by himself, no help. He did. Took him a full day. We later had to 'bleed' the air from the hydraulic lines since he didn't know the importance of no air in hydraulics, but that was it. He followed the instructions meticulously and built a real word prototype that now gets used to build lego castles and intergalactic ships...
customer_reviews.author: Econ Geo

customer_reviews.title: It takes a great deal of patience to put this together
customer_reviews.text: There were hundreds of parts. While they are well crafted and fit together, there was a lot of preparation for each piece. They had to be trimmed carefully. Numerous steps were very repetitive and required patience. This is not a Lego experience. Real science is learned, but again, it requires some maturity and determination.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Lagorio

customer_reviews.title: Great functional model kit
customer_reviews.text: Great product! If you like building models this is a great kit. The parts all fit together very well and are made of decent plastic. Though there are alot of parts and many steps to follow the unit comes with good instructions. If you take your time and go step by step the arm goes together easily.
customer_reviews.author: GallopingGhost

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build and use, but warranty sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's fun. But be careful... the warranty is short! You only have 30 days to claim it if something is bad. We got this as a gift, and the warranty ran out before my son even started assembling it. We ended up buying him another when a part broke. On the flip side, it's a fun project for kids who like mechanical things.
customer_reviews.author: cwm9

customer_reviews.title: Was fun and challenging to build
customer_reviews.text: Was fun and challenging to build, but little stiff to use and usually need a little assistance to work properly. Still cool though.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Apple

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: in my case, we spend hours to assemble this product, difficult to instruction, hydraulics fail to perform as defined in the instruction book. What a waste of time and mooney
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I do wish it was shipped in another box so my son would not have seen it. The product itself is great. I'm not sure if a 10 year old could put this together. It took me 3 hours. I bought this for my 7 year old (who loves robotics) and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie76

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We worked on this a little at a time, took us a month of here and there working on it. It was great quality time with our son and he loves using it. We homeschool so this was a great project.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for my son.
customer_reviews.text: This was the best gift my 13 year old son received for Christmas. He spent hours assembling it himself and had his dad help him finish. The excitement and accomplishment he felt was contagious. The. Best part is he put down his phone to build it and it works great. Highly recommend this for engineering minded kinds.
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for 10 year olds. Incredibly difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Arendes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fun. A 13yr old and 6yr old built ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fun. A 13yr old and 6yr old built 90% of it while I watched. The kids seemed to develop some intuitive understanding of hydraulics. We ended up breaking it a few times and repaired it as lesson if what it can and can't do. We will get another one in a few years to see how much they learned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: A Christmas Keeper
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 20 year old for Christmas. He was wanting to be able to build a hydraulic arm with out soldering and this was perfect. He built it in a few hours and still tweaks it to this day. It’s challenging enough to keep attention but without being so challenging that it’s more frustrating than fun.
customer_reviews.author: irish121199

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Extremely bright 10 Y/O grandson loved this , a bit of a challenge & actually kept him busy for more than 2 days. I'll have to report back on how it's going now that it is all in working order. Is it still fun when finished? More later.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son spent several days putting it together, but when they added water it started leaking! We were so disappointed! It was returned. OWI has other products, so we will probably try to find something that doesn't need water!
customer_reviews.author: KnK

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! My 9YO had a hard time with the parts in directions about the hydraulics, measuring the tubes, routing the tubes and attaching the tubes with cylinders. The 10+ guidelines are very accurate with adult supervision. Cutting the burrs off the parts definitely required adult and a sharp knife. Awesome product and works like described. Well made and the directions were good. Really taught my son about hydraulics and fluid dynamics. Overall great product!!! Would definitely recommend to the kiddo who likes this type of building construction.
customer_reviews.author: Cast and Blast

customer_reviews.title: No batteries required!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of assembly required so plan a couple of hours or more to get it going. The instructions are extensive but clear to understand. The parts are in those plastic forms that you have to twist out and trim or sand any burs off. Do not take the parts out of their molds before you get to the particular step, as they are letter and number coded. The water/hydraulic rams are really cool. Nice to have a toy that doesn’t require batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very playful!
customer_reviews.text: Not difficult to assemble. My 11 year old boy spent 3 hours to build it by himself. But 1 or 2 joining parts has the problem of water leakage
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Yu

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were very clear, everything is labelled and went together very tight. No problems during assembly and my son has been playing with this for months now.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S

customer_reviews.title: Very cool toy for learning basic hydraulics but being plastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 10 year old. Took my 24 year old to put it together. Very cool toy for learning basic hydraulics but being plastic, it can be fragile if used to pick up anything over 1 pound. I had to glue a piece back together one day after it was assembled from a stress fracture.
customer_reviews.author: Al H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a day of activities
customer_reviews.text: My 12-year old was not able to make it function as intended - hydraulics. He enjoyed putting it together but now it just takes up room.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: This this is pretty amazing. Take some time to assemble. They tubes leak water a little do they need re filled here and there but pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Complex kit
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our grandson for his 10th birthday. It was an extremely complicated kit. His dad helped him put it together. I'm not sure the age on the package is appropriate. Otherwise, it is an interesting piece and our grandson seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kollars

customer_reviews.title: Coolest toy ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 yearold loves it! He and his dad had a great time building it. The satisfaction he had from building something that can be used as a toy was for me that alone was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but make sure that you watch younger ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our class setting we use this in stem camp and also for the engineering class. Easy to assemble but make sure that you watch younger children because the arms can break if they move them to quickly. Over a thousand students has used mine and only one arm has broke so far I have purchased three of these.
customer_reviews.author: Tweedy

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Initial reaction: Wow a lot of pieces. I wonder if a 10 year old can do this. Building process: A 10 year old struggles with this and needs someone AT LEAST 12 or above to help. Otherwise it is an exercise of frustration. Summary: For 10 (with a supervisor) or older, great learning tool. The pieces all fit together and the directions were extremely clear. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: MDL

customer_reviews.title: fun and impressive
customer_reviews.text: the kids are very excited about the hydraulic arm! it took quite some effort to set up, so they were focused for a while. It leaks a slight bit of water when resting or when pressed hard (kids), so we have to be careful where we keep it and where they play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Grant

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces, cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Was missing many pieces right out of the box. My son was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MissSillyGoose

customer_reviews.title: Educational & fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 yr. old grandson & he was so excited when it arrived. It took him some time to put it together which is what I wanted and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Great quality and functionality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! First thing I noticed was the quality of the parts; the plastics used are very sturdy. The final product is a very functional robot arm that is built very sturdy. I think I'm enjoying more than my son.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Work to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Tubing slips off and then it leaks and doesn’t work. Don’t use the included oil at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It is missing two parts. Two of the medium rubber pieces for the hinges and pistons and missing.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as well as it states. Son got maybe to play around with it right after he put it together then it didn't do anything really.
customer_reviews.author: katharyne simpson

customer_reviews.title: Hydraulic arm
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my 11-year old grandson who loves to build things. He specifically asked for this and was very happy to receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Collector

customer_reviews.title: This is really cool..
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool...my boys love it although we didn't realize how many small pieces there were and how long it would take!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie 4 Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Not working for long due to water leaking. Great kit otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: The tubes could not hold the water, thus the toy would stop working in only a few minutes. Otherwise, the kit is a great kit to build. There is room for improvement. Replaced the tubing with small hobby silicon tubes and it worked perfectly - no leak. Nice educational toy after all.
customer_reviews.author: Don N.

customer_reviews.title: broke right away
customer_reviews.text: Not very durable. First piece my son tried to put together broke right away.
customer_reviews.author: yanmackay

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE!
customer_reviews.text: After hours of putting this together to find out the hydraulics don't work, it will not hold the water it just leaks everywhere. With multiple attempts to troubleshoot still will not hold the water Thh hi is was a Christmas gift that was not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tobi Davis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mechanical gadget
customer_reviews.text: It took two hours for my 12yo son to finish. The assembly’s much easier if you have a crafting tool set.
customer_reviews.author: doqu

customer_reviews.title: 10+ ? More like ADULT
customer_reviews.text: This is a great STEM toy however it should be for Adult, not 10+. Maybe it means a 10 year old PLUS an Adult LOL Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 3

customer_reviews.title: the Hydraulic arm is absolutely cool. My son is amazed on how functional it ...
customer_reviews.text: Although more of a challenge than the electric OWI robot arm, the Hydraulic arm is absolutely cool. My son is amazed on how functional it is without the use of electricity, just mechanical pressure and leverage. Great present to introduce a young teen to mechanical engineering.
customer_reviews.author: RVJ

customer_reviews.title: Notice is says "KIT."
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a toy. Nope. A full-time job for three weeks. There are 75 pages of instructions. Oh yeah. Holy mackerel is right!
customer_reviews.author: RolledUpSleeves

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old love putting this together
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old love putting this together. It took him a couple hours and he clearly enjoyed it and was very proud of his accomplishment. However, it’s now sitting on a shelf collecting dust
customer_reviews.author: ParTof6

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a present for a 12yr old!
customer_reviews.text: We got great feedback on the purchase from the parents of the boy. He simply loved this Hydraulic Arm!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Used product with missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the pieces were missing. I bought this for my nephew but when we heard a lot of rattling, we decided to open it before giving it to him. The parts that are missing aren't even in the box. There were a couple of stray pieces but was definitely not all of them. At first, I thought this was normal but you can see the parts that are "new" and still intact. Seems like this was a returned product and they just wrapped it up and shipped it again. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K

customer_reviews.title: This is not just fun to assemble, it's durable and works well.
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of these types of STEM toys but this is the real deal. It's durable. My kid loved putting it together. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions fully before starting
customer_reviews.text: Great model for for anyone 10 to whatever age, about a 6 hour build but comes with great instructions, give a child basic understanding of hydraulics and how they work, for the money it's a fun project, a little to much for a beginner but a novice modeler shouldn't have any problems
customer_reviews.author: James webber

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable
customer_reviews.text: Good build. However the screws are to weak, a beter method of hydraulic cylinders should be fixed. The hydraulic cylinders seam to gather air at their curent angle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great time building it with my son - not easy ...
customer_reviews.text: great time building it with my son - not easy building but extremely satisfying. great value for the price, teaching mechanics hydraulics, fine cutting and assembly. highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Arik 😎😎

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool and my grandson's favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect project to do with kids. Perfect instructions. Works fine!
customer_reviews.author: ltmt999

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: When my grandson was assembling, right at the very beginning, a piece broke and he was unable to complete the project. Unfortunately, I am past the window of return or exchange. I would definitely like to exchange it if this is still possible? Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: The product is really cool but not without flaws
customer_reviews.text: The product is really cool but not without flaws. We cannot get grabbing part the suction and the turning lever to work. It could possibly could be that it loses pressure from within and is not airtight. We will likely return it.
customer_reviews.author: shelly carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, waist of birthday gift.
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old who loves to build is in tears because he spent so much time and energy on this and it doesn’t work at all. Wish I could get his birthday money back for it.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Adult assistance needed
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a kit for assembly without adult assistance. The screws are tiny and difficult for even an adult to screw in. Suggest that it be 12+ years rather than 10+ years. My grandson enjoyed the challenge except for the screw part. He is a 12+ yo Lego veteran so this was a good kit for him.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Houston

customer_reviews.title: The package
customer_reviews.text: The product was as advertised. But they deliver it and leave it unwrapped and it is easily identifiable and a easy target for thieves
customer_reviews.author: izapm4u

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hydraulics Taeching Tool
customer_reviews.text: Th minimum number of fasteners. Easy-to-follow instruction. A good product. Highly recommended by a former hydraulics engineer.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun kit to build requires no batteries which is the best part and it works very well once assembled

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 12 year old son. Husband was cursing during assembly. Son lost interest, sitting in a box in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi&Queen

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE PIECES
customer_reviews.text: I'm very unhappy with this product. I spent a whole month of my summer break on this product. When I came to the hydrollic tube it was bouncing the pieces off and was chipped. This is a big inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major assembly/brainpower required!
customer_reviews.text: Box says for ages 10+. I bought it for my 11 year old and it still took him and my husband 5+ hours to assemble! My husband is an engineer with a Master's degree and he said he had to totally focus on all of the instructions! Now that it's built, my son thinks it's the coolest thing on the planet. I did love that they got some great father/son time...but be wary of you cannot have an adult around to build it!
customer_reviews.author: iowa mom

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Do you have 4 hours to build a failed product?
customer_reviews.author: MCRONIN99

customer_reviews.title: Cool and fun claw but work to build
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift/toy! Will definitely need adult help, especially with taking the parts off and cutting plastic down to fit. Be careful not to iverload the hydraulics, the lines will bust.

customer_reviews.title: This is a really neat DIY toy to build along ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat DIY toy to build along side your kids. I worked with my 10 and 9 year old to complete this in a few hours (we had plenty of interruptions!). I was excited building this and I think my kids were excited of the end product. It really was a win-win!

customer_reviews.title: Parents have to assemble it.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to screw in the tiny screws... they stuck. Made building it frustrating and parents are required to put muscle into it. The whole point is for kids to build it but that doesn't happen.

product_meta.title: OWI Hydraulic Arm Edge Kit
product_meta.description: Color:Hydraulic Arm Edge KitRobotic arm technology just got a little more interesting with hydro-mechanically fun. With Hydraulic Arm Edge, you will command six axes of varied movements: the gripper to open and close up to 1.89 inches, wrist rotation of 180 degrees, wrist mobility of 98 degrees, elbow range of 44 degrees, base rotation of 270 degrees, and shoulder motion of 45 degrees. With a vertical reach of 16.35 inches, horizontal reach of 12.42 inches, and lifting capacity of 50g, your robotic friend is ready for your genius to erupt. With the removal of the gripper, you can activate the suction apparatus. This feature enables the user to elevate objects with a larger surface area (like a small mobile phone). Another prodigious attribution is a braking system that is integrated in the lever controllers to execute all commands accurately. WOW! How does this equate to fun? Your children will have total command and manipulation using the science principles of a Hydraulic system and its application. Easy to follow instructions with detailed graphic illustrations pave the way for successful and satisfying kit building. Compliment your engineering, math, science, and technology (STEM) learning strategy. No battery or motor required. It is powered by water; thus, the "Hydraulic" significance and how it manipulates axes movement via lever controllers. - For more than 3 decades, OWI continues its pursuit to satisfy educational instructors and the most discriminating parents. Hydraulic Arm Edge is recommended for ages 10 and up, but with its 229 assembly parts, it will challenge the beginner engineering enthusiasts.
feature_bullets: Step away from the grid - Hydraulic Robotic Arm - No Electricity or batteries needed
Discover hydro-mechanical technology and have fun operating your own hydro-mechanical robotic arm
Removal the gripper and activate the suction apparatus. Enables operators to "vacuum" and lift objects
6 Axes of movement: Gripper opens to 1.89 inches, Wrist rotation 180 degrees, Wrist mobility 98 degrees, Elbow range 44 degrees, Base rotation 270 degrees, and shoulder motion 45 degrees

Detailed graphic illustrations equate to successful kit building. - OWI products are made in Taiwan and include assembly instructions only in English. Other items not matching these descriptions are illegal copies
